NonPII.nonPIIAccessMechanism: Non-PII data can be extracted using the export function within the E-Heza backend application.

adherenceSteps: For countries using the E-Heza software in other regions are responsible for complying with local legislation.

bestPracticesList: E-Heza is developed in line with the Principles for Digital Development.
E-Heza development follows an agile development process, with frequent releases, development in close collaboration with end users, early delivery of working software and emphasis on simplicity.

stepsAddressRiskPreventSafetyUnderageUse: E-Heza is designed to be used only by healthcare workers and implementing organizations are responsible for screening healthcare workers for age. Each device is prescribed a unique pairing PIN which can only be set by an administrator and access is provided to healthcare workers with a unique PIN which identifies them on the device
harassmentProtectionSteps: E-Heza discussion and development is guided by: https://tip-global-health.github.io/eheza-documentation/community_docs/contribute-eheza/#code-of-conduct
E-Heza is actively moderated by the E-Heza project lead, who can flag and remove content or comments as needed.
